subject: Productivity
title: Caffeine Science
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Caffeine Science.

hook.text: Caffeine doesn't give you energy. It blocks the tiredness signal. There's a critical difference.

buildup.text: Adenosine builds up in the brain during waking hours. It signals fatigue. Caffeine blocks adenosine receptors.

discovery.text: The energy you feel is your natural alertness unmasked, not new energy added. The tiredness is still building.

twist.text: Caffeine's half-life is about six hours. A 3pm coffee still has half its effect at 9pm, disrupting sleep.

climax.text: Strategic caffeine use means timing it with your circadian dip, not first thing in the morning.

punchline.text: Caffeine hides tiredness. It doesn't cure it.

quiz.question: How does caffeine actually work in the brain?
options: It blocks adenosine receptors that signal fatigue
